item.title: Carney Looks to Resolve Trump’s Demands Over New Detroit-Canada Bridge
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he spoke to President Trump following his demand that the U.S. get an ownership stake in the Gordie Howe International Bridge.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Netanyahu Flies to D.C. to Keep Israel From Being Outflanked on Iran
item.description: The Israeli prime minister wants to make sure negotiations between Washington and Tehran don’t leave out key concerns like ballistic missiles.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Japan Election Shows Beijing’s Pressure Tactics Can Backfire
item.description: China has sought to punish Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi for remarks she made about Taiwan, but that strategy has largely backfired.
item.dc:creator: Austin Ramzy

item.title: Kenya’s Central Bank Cuts Key Lending Rate
item.description: Kenya’s central bank cut its key lending rate as East Africa’s largest economy continued a policy-loosening cycle to boost private-sector lending and economic growth.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Sterling Stays Weaker Even as U.K. Government Bond Yields Fall Amid Political Uncertainty
item.description: Pressure has mounted on the government over the appointment of Peter Mandelson, former British ambassador to Washington.
item.dc:creator: Renae Dyer

item.title: A Bitcoin Blunder for the Ages: $40 Billion Accidentally Given Away
item.description: A botched prize giveaway has landed a South Korean cryptocurrency exchange in hot water.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Korean Travel App Aims for 2027 IPO as Tourists Flock to Seoul for Skin Care, K-Pop
item.description: Online travel platform Myrealtrip is seeking a valuation roughly north of $1 billion as K-Pop, K-Beauty and a string of Netflix hits drive a rise in tourism to South Korea.
item.dc:creator: Jihye Lee

item.title: Trump Threatens to Block Opening of New Bridge Between Detroit and Canada
item.description: Canada funded the Gordie Howe International Bridge, which is nearly complete.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Opinion | A Weak Iran Means a More Isolated Israel
item.description: The Saudis and other Arabs have grown less enthusiastic about normalizing relations.
item.dc:creator: Walter Russell Mead

item.title: Israel Assumes Broad New Powers in the West Bank
item.description: The Israeli government is deepening a push by far-right ministers to expand its authority and settlements in the West Bank.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Opinion | When Will Donroe Kick Out Qatari Funding?
item.description: The president’s concern about damaging elements entering the U.S. should extend to foreign money.

item.title: U.K.’s Starmer Is in Danger of Becoming First Leader to Fall in Epstein Scandal
item.description: Keir Starmer, who gained office in a landslide election just 19 months ago, was already deeply unpopular.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: Air Canada Suspends Cuba Service Due to Fuel Shortage
item.description: The flag carrier is suspending service, effective Monday, and over the following days it will operate empty flights to Cuba to pick up about 3,000 customers already there.
item.dc:creator: Robb M. Stewart

item.title: How U.S. Special Forces Are Training in an Arctic Warfare Bootcamp
item.description: WSJ’s Sune Engel Rasmussen is the first civilian to take part in this grueling training with a unit of American Green Berets.
item.dc:creator: Eve Hartley

item.title: Opinion | Hamas’s Boasting Indicts the West
item.description: Unlike Hitler and Stalin, today’s mass murderers can expect our elites to cheer their atrocities.
item.dc:creator: Morton Schapiro

item.title: U.S. Seizes Tanker in Indian Ocean After Monthlong Chase From Caribbean
item.description: The sanctioned ship was the eighth vessel apprehended by the U.S. in connection with the quasi blockade of Venezuela’s oil industry.
item.dc:creator: Shelby Holliday

item.title: Bank of France Governor Villeroy to Step Down in June, Before the End of His Term
item.description: The early departure means his successor will be appointed before the next presidential election, rather than after.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: They Came for Its Riches, but Big Business Is Souring on South Africa
item.description: The corporate exodus is accelerating, propelled by a toxic cocktail of corruption, lawlessness and poor infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Deadly Insurgency Threatens a U.S. Plan to Invest in Pakistan’s Mineral Riches
item.description: Militants have escalated attacks in a province where the U.S. wants to invest $1.25 billion as part of its effort to counter China.
item.dc:creator: Waqar Gillani

item.title: Uganda’s Central Bank Holds Key Lending Rate at 9.75%
item.description: Uganda’s central bank maintained its key lending rate at 9.75%, citing rising inflationary pressure and high oil prices amid sustained geopolitical uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Supermajority Gives Japan’s Takaichi Strong Hand at Home and Abroad
item.description: The leader has a chance to push through policies on economy and defense—and might open the door to revising Japan’s constitution.
item.dc:creator: Junko Fukutome

item.title: Japan’s Takaichi Scores Landslide Win in Election Gamble
item.description: The prime minister now has a powerful mandate to draw Japan closer to the U.S. and spend more on defense and industrial policy.
item.dc:creator: Junko Fukutome

item.title: Ukraine Seeks a War Plan Beyond Killing as Many Russian Soldiers as Possible
item.description: As the conflict approaches the four-year mark, Russia’s grinding, slow-motion advance is weakening Kyiv’s hand at the negotiating table.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Walker

item.title: Opinion | Jimmy Lai Gets a Death Sentence
item.description: The 78-year-old publisher has already served years in solitary confinement.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Hong Kong’s Jimmy Lai Given 20-Year Sentence, Adding Friction to U.S.-China Ties
item.description: World leaders have called for the release of the 78-year-old who became the face of the democracy movement.
item.dc:creator: Austin Ramzy

item.title: Conservatives Surge to Surprise Victory in Thai Elections
item.description: The results could inject some stability into the country’s turbulent politics.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: Opinion | America Reclaims Its Dominance in Space
item.description: The first manned moon mission since 1972 will launch next month. China, meanwhile, is struggling.
item.dc:creator: Arthur Herman

item.title: Opinion | Brazil Criminalizes Transgender Dissent
item.description: A feminist could go to prison for asserting that a male can’t become a female.
item.dc:creator: Mary Anastasia O’Grady

item.title: U.K. Prime Minister Starmer’s Top Aide Resigns Amid Epstein Fallout
item.description: Morgan McSweeney has stepped down over his role in the appointment of Peter Mandelson, an old acquaintance of Epstein, as U.K. ambassador to Washington.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Iran Threatens Missile Attacks, Hoping Trump Sees Strength Not Weakness
item.description: The U.S. demanded that Tehran restrict its missile program as part of a deal to avert new clashes, but it has refused so far.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: The U.S. Navy’s New Insurance Policy for War With China Is an Australian Base
item.description: The Pentagon plans to deploy submarines to an expanding facility in allies’ strategy to deter Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Squeezed by U.S. and China, the World’s Middle Powers Are Teaming Up
item.description: Nations are increasingly seeking to bypass the bigger players on trade, supply chains and security.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Iran Refuses to End Nuclear Enrichment in Talks With U.S.
item.description: Tehran stuck to its position, but signaled a willingness to keep working toward a diplomatic solution.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Young Voters Can’t Get Enough of Japan’s Conservative Prime Minister
item.description: Sanae Takaichi’s hardworking persona and social-media savvy are resonating with younger people ahead of the country’s election.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Epstein Fallout Ripples Through Norway’s Elite
item.description: The Epstein files release rocked Norway’s political establishment, spurring an investigation into a former prime minister and drawing a public apology from the country’s crown princess.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Strasburg

item.title: U.S. Accuses China of Secretly Conducting Nuclear Tests
item.description: The allegation comes as the White House pushes Beijing to agree to new nuclear talks after the New Start arms-control deal expired this week.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: U.S. Ties With Key NATO Ally Fray Over Trump’s Quest for Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: A row broke out between the U.S. and Poland after a leading Polish politician refused to join a campaign to lobby for nominations of President Trump for the prize.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: The U.S. Has Powerful Options to Squeeze Concessions From a Weak Cuba
item.description: The Trump administration, which has cut off flows of oil, can target money transfers, goods and flights off the island.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: ‘The Wall Dancers’ Review: Surfing China’s Censored Internet
item.description: Seeking connection and information, Chinese users navigate a version of the web obstructed by the so-called Great Firewall.

item.title: North Korean Soldiers Provide More Advanced Support for Russia’s War on Ukraine
item.description: Forces from North Korea are now operating drones and removing mines, illustrating the improvement in their combat skills.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: Russian General With Key Intelligence Role Is Shot in Moscow
item.description: The attack on the deputy head of the GRU, the Russian military-intelligence agency, follows a series of killings of top military officials in the country.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: U.S. to Allow Aid to North Korea to Resume, While Outreach Stalls
item.description: Kim Jong Un’s regime has deepened ties to Russia and China, and ignored diplomatic overtures.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: A Second Wave of Popular Anger Is Building in Iran
item.description: The heavy-handed response to protests has deepened people’s hatred of the regime, and Iranians are speaking out.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Takaichi’s Long Trip From Heavy-Metal Drummer to Japan’s Political Heavyweight
item.description: The conservative prime minister bet her seat in a snap election Sunday she hopes will cement her power—and move Japan closer to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Junko Fukutome

item.title: Trump Calls for New Nuclear Pact With Russia as Previous Treaty Ends
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said future arms constraints should include China.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: Argentina Inflation Battle Jolts Confidence in Milei’s Overhaul
item.description: The resignation of Argentina’s statistics chief over delays in updating the inflation index has stirred up memories of price meddling.
item.dc:creator: Silvina Frydlewsky

item.title: Trump Softens Criticism of U.K. Deal Ceding Control of Indian Ocean Island
item.description: The comments came as the British government has moved forward with a deal to cede sovereignty of Diego Garcia to Mauritius.

item.title: U.K. Long-Term Borrowing Costs Climb, Sterling Falls as Political Uncertainty Grows
item.description: Pressure has built on U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer over his appointment of former British ambassador to Washington Peter Mandelson.

item.title: Epstein Fallout Piles Pressure on U.K. Prime Minister
item.description: Keir Starmer—already trailing in the polls —faces questions over his decision to appoint an old Epstein friend as ambassador to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Why Big Tech Is Throwing Cash Into India in Quest for AI Supremacy
item.description: Lured by its big, tech-savvy population, Google and other giants are sinking tens of billions into the Indian market.

item.title: A Wargame Shows Just How Vulnerable Europe Is to a Russian Attack
item.description: With America disengaging, Russia might be ready for a new war much sooner than previously estimated.

item.title: The American and Chinese Economies Are Hurtling Toward a Messy Divorce
item.description: The breakup is focused on sensitive matters now considered national-security issues, including semiconductors, food and energy.

item.title: U.S., Iran Agree to Discuss Nuclear Issues Friday in Oman
item.description: The talks had been in danger of collapsing over the agenda and location.

item.title: Why India Will Struggle to Reduce Its Reliance on Russian Oil
item.description: India relies on Russia for roughly a third of its oil imports, up from just 2% before Russia invaded Ukraine in early 2022.

item.title: U.S.-Iranian Talks Are Still Expected After Gulf Flare-Ups
item.description: The U.S. shot down an Iranian drone aimed at an aircraft carrier and Iranian gunboats tried to stop a U.S.-flagged ship.

item.title: India’s Middle-Power Strategy Won It a Reprieve From Trump’s Sky-High Tariffs
item.description: New Delhi powered ahead with trade deals that strengthened its hand in negotiations with the U.S.

item.title: U.S. Will Cut Tariffs on India to 18% in Trade Deal
item.description: President Trump said Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi agreed to stop buying Russian oil and boost American purchases.

item.title: Zelensky Voices Support for U.S.-Backed ‘Energy Truce’ With Russia
item.description: An agreement to pause strikes on energy infrastructure would be the first tangible result from a renewed push for peace in Ukraine.

item.title: Trump Faces High-Stakes Choice as Final Nuclear Pact With Russia Expires
item.description: Moscow has proposed a de facto one-year extension of limits on long-range nuclear weapons after a strategic arms treaty lapses next week, but the president has yet to commit
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: A Plan to Save Elephants Sparked a Deadly Conflict
item.description: The conservation project was supposed to rebuild the elephant population. It became a cautionary tale instead.

item.title: How Trump’s Push for Peace in Ukraine Will Unfold: Three Scenarios
item.description: More war is most likely, but mounting strains this year could weaken Kyiv’s or Moscow’s hand.

item.title: EU and India Reach Free-Trade Deal as World Responds to Trump Tariffs
item.description: The agreement is both economies’ largest and will link almost two billion consumers.

item.title: Several People Missing After Landslide Buries Campground in New Zealand
item.description: Debris engulfed the site at Mount Maunganui following record rainfall. A government minister said young people were among the missing.

item.title: Can a U.S.-Greenland Partnership Work? Just Look at These Pacific Islands
item.description: U.S. agreements with three island nations have benefited both sides but have also had challenges.

item.title: British American Tobacco to End South African Manufacturing
item.description: BAT South Africa said it would cease cigarette production in the country because of “the devastating impact of the illicit cigarette trade”.

item.description: Police charged 24-year-old Naveed Akram after he woke up from a coma.

item.title: Bondi Beach Attack Badly Shakes Sense of Safety for Australia’s Jews
item.description: There has been frustration among Sydney’s Jewish community that authorities haven’t heeded warnings about a rise in antisemitism.

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.

item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
